results.title: Product Owner
results.description:
At Human API, we exist to radically accelerate the pace of health innovation for everyone. That is our vision. We unlock siloed health data from everywhere and put it directly into the hands of the consumer, right when they need it: enabling a meaningful transaction that creates value in their lives. Some call us the "PayPal" of health data, but our dreams are bigger. 

To name a few examples, we help rapidly screen participants for clinical trials, enable life-changing software through accurate wearable data, and we accelerate the buying process for important insurance products.  Tomorrow we will inspire the innovation of impactful digital health products to maximize human longevity and potential. We are looking for talent who are equally inspired by these big ideas and have the grit and determination to make them come to life.

As a Product Owner, you’ll support the execution of product solutions for our core vertical markets; Life Insurance and Life Sciences.  This role will translate our strategic roadmap into a clear, functional backlog and then drive the  development of these new capabilities. The ultimate goal of this role is to build and deliver the right features at the right time to maximize revenue growth, client satisfaction and solution adoption.   

Human API is a product led company. This is an opportunity to make a major impact on our company and the healthcare industry at large. 


What you'll do
  • Drive the solutioning process to convert high level roadmap items into detailed epics and user stories that feed our execution backlog
  • Represent the voice of the user and define minimum viable scope for each item on the roadmap
  • Manage the tradeoffs within each epic to balance scope, time and resources while delivering on the epic’s goal 
  • Work with Customer Success and Operational Teams to understand, scope and prioritize customer friction points and product bugs within the context of larger strategic priorities.
  • Write clear, verifiable acceptance criteria
  • Participate in validation of completed stories throughout the sprint
  • Demo completed functionality at sprint reviews
  • Build trusted relationships with cross-functional teams in order to deliver predictable, high-quality outcomes
  • Tirelessly chase down open questions, blockers, and dependencies.  
  • Stay true to our values, including serve the human first; which means prioritizing consumer transparency, trust and privacy


About You
  • 2+ years of relevant product owner or product manager experience working with SaaS, B2B software, or enterprise software platforms
  • Experience effectively working in an Agile Scrum environment 
  • Experience owning a product backlog and prioritizing features
  • Former practice with the process of product definition and validation; delivering MVP products and then iterating to improve them
  • Ready to be in a remote-first work culture and the sense of accountability to be successful in it.
  • Business Minded. Eager and able to connect each new feature to the business value they provide to our customers. 
  • Good product intuition; you can gather insights and synthesize customer needs into clear product requirements and roadmap.
  • The ability to influence people to get things done across the organization, striving to remove complexity and simplify both ideas and communication
  • Familiarity and comfort with the pace of an early stage company


Bonus
  • Previous experience with medical data 
  • Specific experience within Life Insurance or Life Sciences industries
The national, annual salary range for this position is $100,000 to $115,000 commensurate with experience.

We’re built by strong venture backing from Andreessen Horowitz, Blue Run Ventures, SCOR Global, Allianz, Guardian Life Insurance Company, and Samsung Ventures and currently serve some of the largest financial and health companies in the world from Prudential, Allstate, John Hancock, Omada Health, Thrive Global, AAA, and many more. 

We have thousands of API integrations into enterprise health record systems, wearable devices, as well as health and wellness applications, that all benefit the end consumer and our enterprise customers.  We’re looking for independent thinkers who care deeply about the problems we’re trying to solve. At Human API, we welcome people of all backgrounds.

results.title: Product Owner
results.description:
SUMMARY

As a Product Owner in our Client Delivery team you will define, prioritize, and evaluate the work based on Client requirements for new implementations, change requests and maintenance upgrades to optimize the business value delivered by your scrum team. You will work with subject matter experts at our customers and within Vestmark to develop the user stories for product enhancements and oversee product enhancements throughout the development lifecycle.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS*

  • Participate in discovery alongside key stakeholders ensuring a significant understanding of requirements to share with the development team.
  • Partner with Products to understand new features
  • Coordinate, facilitate and/or conduct as needed demonstrations
  • Manage Change Request assignments with the scrum team and ascertain priority and timing expectations with the client/RM
  • Manage upgrades and maintenance releases with scrum team
  • Work with internal/external client teams to document business requirements
  • Write internal/external user stories and acceptance criteria and conduct walkthroughs as needed
  • Refine user stories with the scrum team
  • Establish priorities, collaborating with client or internal relationship managers when needed
  • Prioritize interruptions against sprint work
  • Maintain scrum team backlog
  • Creating & Maintaining epics for projects
  • Owning the status of an epic and ensuring they are closed when work is complete
  • Strive to have 1-3 future sprints planned
  • Work with scrum master to resolve impediments preventing team from meeting sprint goals
  • Be available for adhoc questions raised by the scrum team
  • Testing on adhoc basis as needed

PREPARATION, KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES

  • Experience: 3+ years’ experience as a Product Owner or Business Analyst with knowledge of Agile process and principles
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills
  • Sharp analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Financial industry knowledge, particularly in the areas of portfolio management, portfolio accounting, or trading operations
  • Familiarity with the data associated with the processing of securities, transactions, and positions of either retail or institutional portfolios
  • Experience with software delivery
  • Enterprise software company experience or experience in a professional services organization delivering enterprise software used by financial services organizations
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Strong and effective customer service skills
  • Bright with a high degree of initiative to learn and work collaboratively to solve problems
  • Do what it takes attitude, displaying positive energy even in challenging situations
  • Strong communication skills; able to respond and exchange ideas clearly and effectively through writing, speaking, and presentations; shares appropriate information to keep people informed

COMPETENCIES

  • Teamwork – We before me-- Puts needs of team first and aspires to bring out the best in others; collaborative, empathetic and humble; values the opinions of others; assists others when needed; participates effectively as member of a team; balances personal contributions and needs with those of other members of the team to achieve common objectives.
  • Knowledge Explorer – Creative problem solver and adapts to challenges at hand using creative collaboration; curious, proactive and resourceful; able to incorporate other viewpoints as part of the process of developing solutions
  • Positive Energy – Ability to address difficult situations with humor and sense of opportunity; approachable, constructive and engaged
  • Own It- Empathetic and accountable until the end.

WORKING CONDITIONS/PHYSICAL DEMANDS

  • Willingness to travel occasionally on as needed basis. 

BENEFITS

  • Vestmark pays 90% of Medical and Dental insurance premium
  • Vestmark sponsored Life, STD, and LTD Benefits
  • Generous PTO
  • Company equity in the form of Restricted Stock Units
  • 401(k) with Employer Matching
  • Employee Assistance Program

 

Vestmark is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Vestmark prohibits employment discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, national origin, age, disability status, protected military or veteran status, and genetic information.

This role cannot be performed by a resident of New York City, NY.

results.title: Head of Product - Rider Experience
results.description:
Description

About Masabi:

At Masabi, we are helping to make cities better places to live, work, and visit by enabling seamless, frictionless journeys on public transport systems. We are a SaaS company developing a fare collection platform that allows people to buy and present tickets for public transit on their mobile phones or by tapping a bank card or smart card to travel. 

 

We believe a new fare payments system allowing passengers to tap and ride without needing to buy a ticket or understand fares should be available to every passenger and every transit agency around the globe, without prohibitive costs or taking years to deliver, helping people move seamlessly from A to B.

 

Our Justride platform has won numerous awards and is used in over 150 locations worldwide, including New York, London, Boston, Las Vegas, Valencia, The Hague, Los Angeles, Melbourne, and many more. With an exciting industry-first mobile ticketing SDK, we are partnering with companies like Uber, Lyft, Transit, Moovit to enable the purchase of public transit tickets within leading mobility applications.

 

Join us on this exciting ride as we build the transit technology ecosystem of tomorrow.

 

 

The Role: 

We’re looking for a Head of Rider Experience Products to own the products and integrations that Masabi builds to make riding transit an easy and enjoyable experience for our global users. 

 

The primary focus for this role will be Masabi’s app, web portal, and partner integrations across the broader mobility space, with a broader view of the rider's experience across our platform as they plan, use, and pay for transit and mobility services, interacting with both digital and physical channels. 

 

Using a deep understanding of the diverse transit riders and agencies we serve, and working with internal and external partners, you will work on developing a roadmap that creates new value for riders, agencies, and the Masabi business.

 

 

Location: This role is available for candidates in Canada, anywhere on the EST time zone

 

 

Responsibilities: 

  • Define the product vision for the Rider Experience area, identifying near and long-term initiatives to build your product roadmap
  • Set the overall strategy for Masabi Rider Experience products and partnerships, defining the product offerings that agencies need (as well as those they don’t even know they need) and working with customer-facing teams on go-to-market approaches
  • Use your experience with transit apps and data as well as customer experience enablement to innovate on rider journeys and agencies’ ability to serve and engage with them, identifying opportunities to drive ridership, satisfaction, and adoption
  • Develop a deep understanding of the marketplace for rider experience technology, including transit rider needs and challenges, and emerging trends and technologies
  • Understand the specific needs and opportunities of target markets and segments in a diverse global context
  • Identify, evaluate, and execute partnership opportunities that enhance the Rider Experience, managing relationships with current and future partners for your area
  • Oversee successful delivery across your product area, and support notable launches that result in enhanced client and rider adoption and satisfaction
  • Manage complex cross-functional dependencies with product and engineering leaders to ensure a holistic approach across the portfolio and take the lead on advocating for the rider experience across the product portfolio  
  • Build and foster a strong team culture with a focus on execution and results, and provide direct leadership to product managers in the Rider Experience product area

 

 

About You:

  • Solid B2B and B2C product management experience at a global scale, ideally in transit and/or payments
  • Experience with people management, including mentoring and guiding product managers
  • Obsessed with creating magical customer experiences and able to do it at scale, preferably in a transit or payment product context 
  • A commercial mindset with a clear track record of delivering innovative and high-value solutions to hard problems 
  • Data hungry, and experienced at getting and analysing the data required to make evidence-based decisions that drive the right outcomes for our customers and business
  • Successfully launched new apps with high volume and positive customer response in the market in the past, and have managed multiple sizeable product lines
  • Experience working in fast-paced, high-growth organisations
  • Technology savvy, with exposure to front-end web and mobile development approaches, data and analytics, integration and data standards, and customer experience technology

 

 

Some of our benefits:

  • Competitive salary package
  • 20 days of vacation per year (in addition to public holidays), plus the option to buy an additional 5 days of vacation each year. On top of this, our office is shut every year between Christmas and New Year, totalling a whopping 28+ days of vacation
  • Private Healthcare and Life Insurance via Trinet
  • Choice of a workstation
  • CA$300 per year to spend on your home office
  • Ability to work for up to 3 months per year from any country in the world
  • Enhanced family leave
  • Fun and collaborative environment with a focus on making a difference in the world

 

 

Diversity:

We celebrate multiple approaches and points of view, striving to create an environment where everyone feels empowered to bring their whole, authentic selves to work. Whoever you are, just be yourself. We encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds to apply; we don’t discriminate. Also, please notify our team of your pronouns at any point in your application. 

 

Interviewing:

All interviews are expected to take place by phone or video.

 

Remote working:

Masabi’s flexible working policy will allow you to work entirely remotely, or from one of our offices in London, Cluj, New York, Denver or Boston. The choice about where you work from will be primarily made by you. Regardless of where you choose to work from, you will be allowed to work outside of the country of your employment for up to 3 months each year.

 

To find out more about who we are and how we work, please have a read about how our business reacted to the Covid pandemic: https://www.masabi.com/2021/08/02/emerging-stronger/

Requirements

None

results.title: Director, Product
results.description:
Loyal is an organization centered on experience and building a platform that allows consumers to make meaningful decisions when it comes to healthcare. We deeply understand providers, locations, services, appointments, business rules, and moreover, we understand patients -- who they are, the preferred method of communication, upcoming appointments, lapsed appointments, outstanding bills, health risks, and more. With this intelligence, our platform fuels highly relevant and personalized experiences across all mediums (website, email, voice…) allowing patients to get healthy, stay healthy, and have a better relationship with the health care provider.

**This is a remote role**

Job Summary 

The Director, Product role is responsible for product planning, strategy and execution for our Digital Front Door and Shared Services division of products. Products in this division include, but are not limited to; Conversational AI, Web Search, Web Scheduling, Data Management, EHR Integrations, and Portal Services. 

The Director, Product is responsible for defining the vision for the division and collaborating with other leaders from the engineering, marketing, sales, and operations departments to ensure that financial, customer, and user satisfaction goals are met. This role will also work closely with other Director, Product roles to ensure effective and efficient cross-division coordination. Most importantly, this role is responsible for coaching and growing the product managers within the division.

Job Duties 

  • Develop long term strategy, vision and high-level priorities for your product team(s) in alignment with company priorities
  • Continuously engage customers to gain insight into customer needs and represent Loyal’s products
  • Practice effective internal and external communication, ensuring that priorities, high-profile metrics, and projects are well communicated and well understood
  • Partner with Engineering and Design to foster empowered product delivery teams operating effectively at all levels 
  • Collaborate with Leadership, Marketing, Customer Success, and other functional areas to gain new insights, unlock opportunities, and work together more effectively, with a specific focus on enabling go-to-market strategies.
  • Manage cross-team dynamics to ensure the entire team is successful, proactively instituting process improvements across your team, e.g., review and provide feedback on roadmaps, strategic plans and feature specs
  • Coach team members to use modern, effective, and data-driven product management practices to de-risk decisions and create value 
  • Plan the structure of your team, managing headcount, succession planning, external hires and internal transfers 
  • Motivate your team to ensure they are engaged and connected to the larger company mission

Education and Experience

  • 7+ years of technology product management experience
  • 3+ years of experience managing people 
  • Experience working in the healthcare technology space preferred
  • Strong preference for experience integrating with EHRs
  • Experience working within a software as a service (SaaS) company preferred
  • Experience working within a start-up and/or ambiguous environment, with proven experience to be adaptable preferred

 

Knowledge and Skills

  • Management: You have directly managed a team of product managers
  • Execution: You have led multiple product teams which are able to execute consistently, delivering quality projects of the broadest scope and impact on time
  • UX: You are passionate about creating intuitive, simple user experiences.  You have a strong eye for usability and quality design.  You are a strong partner to and advocate for design
  • Technical: You are comfortable working with engineering leadership to prioritize broadly and you understand technical complexities of your product areas
  • Analytical: You have a good grasp of experiment design, statistical analysis and multivariate testing.  You can use data to set OKRs, create dashboards to monitor product health, review analyses from across the company and develop basic models. You can construct a narrative for using data in order to drive the decision making process
  • Organizational skills: You are able to manage multiple teams with stakeholders across the organization. You have experience working closely with business & marketing partners
  • Communication: You’re a strong communicator, both written and orally. You enjoy working with complex concepts and distilling them down so that anyone can understand them. You’re comfortable working cross functionally with stakeholders and can manage competing needs to drive alignment and resolution
  • Diplomatic: You know how to work with all different types of personalities, and can navigate tough conversations
  • Adaptive: You are curious, optimistic and a skilled problem-solver.  You embrace the unknown and are able to adapt to shifts in priorities.You look outside your day to day to ensure you keep learning and growing

 

#LI-REMOTE

 

We know that potential candidates are often less likely to apply to a position if they don’t match 100% of the job qualifications.  Don’t let that be why you miss out on this opportunity!  We encourage you to apply if you can demonstrate many of these skills and competencies. 
 
Loyal to our employees
 
We are a remote-friendly company! We encourage you to apply from anywhere in the United States. We also believe in a work/life balance that fulfills you while you’re here and supports you when you’re not. We built our benefits package to prove that we’re committed to you having everything you need (including a little fun).  Here is what we offer full-time employees:
  • Flexible paid time off, sick and personal days
  • At least one holiday per month (sometimes, more!)
  • Full health, dental, and vision insurance - Loyal pays the premium for all employees!
  • One Time Home Office Setup Stipend For Remote & Hybrid Roles
  • Monthly Internet Stipend for Remote & Hybrid Roles
  • Long term & short term disability 
  • 401[k] plan
  • 16 Weeks Paid Parental Leave
  • 2 Volunteer days per year
  • Matching Gift Program
  • Participation Grant Program
  • Annual Travel/Team Events up to twice per year (post-COVID)
Our Commitment

We believe that the key to Loyal's success is you. Your unique background, life experience, knowledge, self-expression, and talent make you uniquely you. Who you are, what you have experienced, and how you think inspires us to be innovative and bold.

Loyal is an equal opportunity employer. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. We welcome the unique contributions that you can bring in terms of your education, opinions, culture, ethnicity, race, ancestry, sex, gender identity and expression, national origin, citizenship, marital status, age, languages spoken, veteran status, color, religion, disability, sexual orientation, and beliefs.

We consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

Further, consistent with applicable federal and state law, Loyal provides reasonable accommodations when requested by qualified applicants or employees with disabilities, unless doing so would cause an undue hardship. Loyal’s policy regarding requests for reasonable accommodation applies to all aspects of employment, including the application process. If you require a reasonable accommodation in connection with the application process, please contact the Talent Acquisition Department at talentacquisition@loyalhealth.com.

E-Verify
 
This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. If E-Verify cannot confirm that you are authorized to work, this employer is required to give you written instructions and an opportunity to contact Department of Homeland Security (DHS) or Social Security Administration (SSA) so you can begin to resolve the issue before the employer can take any action against you, including terminating your employment. Employers can only use E-Verify once you have accepted a job offer and completed the I-9 Form.   

COVID-19 Vaccinations

Consistent with Loyal policy, candidates performing in-person work will be required to show proof of being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 upon commencing employment. Reasonable accommodations will be considered on a case-by-case basis for exemptions to this requirement in accordance with applicable law. If you require a reasonable accommodation to Loyal’s vaccination requirement, please contact the People Department at people@loyalhealth.com.

results.title: Senior Product Manager
results.description:
Sequence exists to magically simplify financial operations for modern companies.

At the end of your career, we want you to look back at your time with Sequence and say it was the best job you ever had. 

We're remote within +/-5  hours of GMT, or you can work from our Hub in central London.

 

The role

We're looking for a Senior Product Manager who will be at the centre of all the activity at Sequence, helping us build one of the best, most innovative finance operations software platforms of all time.

Working directly with the CEO, Growth team and wider Engineering team, you will be responsible for identifying user problems, defining new opportunities and shipping new product features that will delight our customers.

 

What you'll do

  • Develop and execute our product roll-out strategy for new features.

  • Whiteboard new user experiences and optimise the flows.

  • Collaborate with a wide range of stakeholders to understand requirements, align expectations and effectively prioritise the product roadmap.

  • Design wireframes and mockups to communicate solutions with Engineering and Design teams.

  • Work with cross-functional teams to move a proposition from an initial concept through the various new product development stages to delivery and launch.

  • Conduct quantitative and qualitative research to understand user needs and industry trends, creating processes to incorporate feedback and quickly capture learnings to adapt the product for future releases.

  • Communicate constantly and deliver product vision across the company.

  • Refine and improve the product using a range of best practice techniques and emerging technologies with a focus on delivering a product that offers a differentiated and unique, quality user experience.

 

Who you'll be

  • You are a clear strategic thinker, able to produce high quality documentation to drive alignment and clarity.

  • You bring solid experience building products for business and developer-focused products in big tech companies, working in payments, fintech products.

  • You have got your hands dirty shipping features across various platforms.

  • You have a true delivery mindset, with demonstrable experience of increasing velocity and engagement within your teams.

  • You have experience in building products and experiences at scale.

  • You bring excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

  • You are empathetic to the problems our users face and are constantly learning and proposing increasingly new ways we could solve them.

results.title: Growth Product Manager, Matcha
results.description:
COMPANY

At 0x Labs, our mission is to create a tokenized world where all value can flow freely. We’re a mission-driven and diverse team composed of world class talent from Coinbase, Google, Meta, Bitso, Citi, Spotify and other top companies. We are a remote-first and fully distributed company, with team members located across all of the continents besides Antarctica. As early pioneers in the space, we’ve made significant technical contributions to various Ethereum standards over the years; fun fact - our team helped establish the NFT token standard (ERC721).

In joining us, you'll take part in transforming the way that value is exchanged on a global scale. We're passionate about open-source software and decentralized technology's potential to act as an equalizing force in the world, and our technology is deployed by a wide array of projects at the forefront of internet and economic advancement.

Founded in 2017, 0x Labs created and now partakes in the development of 0x protocol: the open-source, global backbone for decentralized exchange. Alongside the core protocol, we also build and maintain products and service offerings including Matcha, the search engine for tokens, and 0x API, the endpoint for multi-chain aggregated liquidity. All of these offerings allow 0x Labs to continue marching towards our vision of building a tokenized world where all value can flow freely at the best prices and with the lowest transaction costs. This way, we can help businesses eliminate the complexity of accessing decentralized markets across all layers of the Web3 exchange stack and have more time to focus on what matters most: their product. 

0x currently supports 8 major blockchains: Ethereum, Polygon, Fantom, Avalanche, Arbitrum, Optimism, BNB Chain, and Celo, and the 0x ecosystem has been rapidly expanding. With integrations across all of the top wallets and apps, including MetaMask, Coinbase Wallet and Coinbase NFT, Polygon Wallet, Brave, Matcha, dYdX, Zapper, Zerion, and Shapeshift, 0x is fast becoming the trusted standard for all decentralized exchange.

We’re a remote-first company with core contributors in nearly ten countries and over twice as many cities. Our headquarters is in San Francisco, with an office available for anyone on the team to use at any time. We’ll consider your application regardless of where you call home.


MATCHA

Matcha is 0x Labs’ first consumer product. It is a meticulously designed decentralized exchange that makes it easy for anyone in the world to access crypto assets on the Ethereum blockchain safely. Powered by the 0x API, we provide users with the best prices by aggregating liquidity from all of the major decentralized exchanges and splitting/routing orders intelligently.

By focusing on user experience and education, Matcha will onboard the next wave of users into the DeFi ecosystem. As a Growth Product Manager on the team, you’ll take large and early part in building and scaling this flagship product.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Lead and guide product direction for a cross-functional team of engineers and designers
  • Drive a product-led growth culture
  • Research and intimately understand our target users and our product funnel. Translate growth opportunities into short-, medium-, and long-term product roadmaps that will have a direct positive impact on Matcha’s growth
  • Design, run and interpret experiments and A/B tests
  • Craft metrics that accurately reflect Matcha’s growth goals
  • Clearly communicate your team's priorities and product roadmap with leadership stakeholders and drive alignment across multiple teams in scrappy ways


REQUIREMENTS

  • At least 3 years of Growth Product Management experience working with consumer products preferably in crypto, fin-tech startups or gaming
  • You have taken a product from 0 to scale, ideally in consumer tech or fin-tech
  • Have a growth mindset and experience using research, experimentation and product analytics to make product changes that improve conversion
  • Familiarity with crypto/web3 and DeFi. Some would say you are a power user
  • Deep analytical expertise; you will partner with our data science team, but you should be able to perform basic data analysis/querying skills yourself
  • Strong communication and writing skills
  • Passion for the benefits of decentralization and the 0x mission
  • Exhibit our core values: do the right thing, consistently ship, and focus on long-term impact

BENEFITS

  • Competitive salary and equity with occasional cryptocurrency-based perks
  • Comprehensive insurance (medical/dental/vision/life/disability) — 100% covered for you and dependents
  • 401k, HSA, and FSA for U.S.-based employees
  • Monthly mobile phone bill, wellness, and pre-tax transportation expense
  • Covered mental health benefits (included professional therapy sessions)
  • Flexible hours, liberal work-from-home policy, and a supportive remote environment
  • Lunch reimbursement for all employees across the globe!
  • Stipend for your ideal remote / WFH set-up: laptop, headphones, and any other work gear you may need
  • 12-week paid parental leave
  • Great office conveniently located in Soma/East Cut, SF
  • Unlimited vacation: Take time when you need it (and we really mean it)
  • Multiple annual in-person team meet-ups around the globe

0x Labs and its associated entities (0x) are dedicated to fostering diversity, inclusion, and belonging in its teams and workforce, and are proud to be equal opportunity employers. 0x does not make employment or hiring decisions on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender expression or identity, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, citizenship, national origin, or any other basis that is protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws. 0x will also consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in a way that is consistent with San Francisco’s Fair Chance Ordinance and similar local laws.

results.title: Senior Product Manager
results.description:
At Beyond Identity, product management is a strategic function whose mandate is to understand our prospects and customers so we can be the Voice of the Customer. You will start with “why” and “who” to create a common understanding of the personas we serve and the value we create. You will leverage your understanding of the competitive landscape and knowledge of the underlying technologies to augment and strengthen these inputs. You will build upon all of these to define the “what” in the product roadmap and lead the organization to achieve it. 

You will leverage strong product instincts while collecting and synthesizing input from many sources and empowering the team to continuously deliver customer value. You will bring empathy, humility, and a continuous learning mindset every day. You are motivated to innovate and create, to always do the right thing, and to build a sustaining product and company.

Responsibilities: 

  • Engage with security, identity and IT leaders at prospects and customers to understand market trends, detailed requirements, architectural capabilities and constraints, and use cases
  • Define, build alignment with, and lead the execution of the strategy and roadmap for mobile and desktop / laptop product capabilities with a razor focus on the experience and functionality afforded both administrators and end users
  • Define and measure lead and lag metrics to determine the utilization and success of releases
  • Write, prioritize and accept user stories and epics
  • Team with Design to iterate and deliver holistic requirements to Engineering
  • Actively participate in 1-2 Agile teams to deliver predictable releases
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing, Support and Cloud Engineering to ensure organizational readiness for releases

Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of B2B software product management experience
  • 3+ years of experience implementing, administering and/or supporting Windows, macOS and Linux desktops in enterprises -OR- being a product manager for endpoint software products
  • 3+ years of experience with native iOS and/or Android mobile applications that tightly integrate to the underlying operating system 
  • Ability to synthesize different perspectives and make recommendations and decisions with incomplete information and ambiguity
  • Experience with and advocate for Agile and user-centered design
  • Experience at and thrive in a startup or early-stage environment
  • Think strategically and act tactically; proven ability to define and translate a vision into detailed and actionable plans
  • Understand how to leverage experience and intuition while adapting to new situations
  • Team player & strong collaborator who proactively engages stakeholders for input, validation and building consensus
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Comfortable presenting to executive, sales and technical audiences
Beyond Identity Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills, and experiences within our workforce.
About Company

Beyond Identity is fundamentally changing how the world logs in with a groundbreaking invisible, un-phishable MFA platform that provides the most secure and frictionless authentication on the planet. We stop ransomware and account takeover attacks in their tracks and dramatically improve the user experience. Beyond Identity’s state-of-the-art platform eliminates passwords and other phishable factors, enabling organizations to confidently validate users’ identities. The solution ensures users log in from authorized devices, and that the device meets the security policy requirements during login and continuously after that. Our revolutionary approach empowers zero trust by cryptographically binding the user’s identity to their device and analyzing hundreds of risk signals on an ongoing basis. The company’s advanced risk policy engine enables organizations to implement foundationally secure authentication and utilize risk signals for protection, rather than just for detection and response. For more information on why Intuit, Snowflake, and Roblox use Beyond Identity, please visit www.beyondidentity.com.

results.title: Risk Product Manager
results.description:
Who we are

Sendwave is on a mission to make sending funds to loved ones as easy and affordable as sending a text. What makes us stand out in a sea of similar apps? We deeply care about the diasporas and communities we serve — and that comes with a sense of connection to the markets we operate in. We strive to make life better for everyone who touches our product. That means recognizing and honoring the human experience behind sending money. We do that by remaining fee-free in most of our markets and offering round-the-clock customer care.

Our app is currently available in the United States, United Kingdom, Canada, and parts of Europe, and sends funds to 19 receiving countries for over 500,000 users. We currently have a 4.6-star rating on Trustpilot — people put their faith in us to deliver their money quickly, securely, and affordably. And we’re pretty darn proud of that.

How we work

What we’re most proud of though is our brilliant, creative, and tenacious team. Our remote-first workplace means you’ll be working with Sendwavers in Europe, Africa, South America, and the U.S. that all share a core set of Sendwave values. What exactly are those values? Glad you asked.

  1. Prioritize fearlessly.
     There will always be more problems to solve and opportunities to pursue than we have the capacity for. We’re not afraid to say no and are willing to let fires burn, knowing that to win we must discern and execute decisively on the vital few rather than the important many.
  2. Take full ownership of the outcomes we’re responsible for.
    Our job is not to do what we can to solve a problem. It's to ensure that problem is solved. If an attempt to solve a problem doesn't work, we seek an alternative. If we need help, we request it, and, if necessary, demand it.
  3. Forge a diverse team and inclusive culture.
    We believe the challenges we’re addressing will be best met by a truly global, diverse team, working together. We’re not naive to the systemic bias and discrimination that make this easier said than done, so we check our egos, listen deeply, and measure progress towards making this a fundamental part of our success.
  4. Maximize our rate of learning.
    We view projects as ever-evolving drafts and welcome opportunities to discover that what we had in mind won't work so we can move to an even better end state. Most importantly, we do this fast. The faster we run these loops — as a company and individuals — the faster we’ll achieve our mission.
  5. Embrace embarrassing honesty from ourselves and others.
    We function best when we're open and honest with one another — especially about our challenges and doubts. We lean into uncomfortable conversations and support our colleagues when they do the same.
  6. Maximize energy, not time spent.
    We measure our own and others’ contributions by objectives reached, not time spent. Living a full life outside of work is necessary for high achievement over the long term.

 

How you’ll help us achieve it

If you’ve ever seen The Tinder Swindler , FYRE, or The Wizard of Lies you know fraud is an infinitely repeating social struggle that leaves the most vulnerable to pay the price. The Risk team at Sendwave builds and supports everything needed to aggregate the individual fraud cases and stop the scheme from ever being lucrative for the fraudster.

Being the Risk Product Manager will include many typical tasks like exploring vendor tools, coordinating large projects across teams and communicating the status of fraud throughout the company. However, a successful Risk Product Manager will be the creative genius behind the next generation of user verification techniques.

After the targeted Data Science defenses have detected a potential fraud case the user has the opportunity to move through one of our verification processes and unblock themselves, typically this looks like submitting an ID or speaking with a Support Rep. We would like to expand our suit of verification techniques by 5x through:

  • creative understanding of our fraudsters
  • careful rollout and rollback verification processes
  • a data-based understanding of the effectiveness
  • “User Self-Serve” automations wherever possible

Want to learn more about our hiring process for this role? Please access our HIRING PLAYBOOK HERE

What you bring to the table:
  • Clear communication skills and understanding of how to implement new experiments, making complex tradeoffs about what’s best for our users and our business thoughtfully and collaboratively.
  • A love for solving hard puzzles with solutions that make others question your mental sanity.
  • a knack for tinkering with A/B testing, statistical analysis, and other quantitative techniques to understand how we can optimize and improve key business metrics.
  • A degree (or equivalent experience) in a quantitative or technical field such as statistics, math, economics, and computer science. Sharp data analytics skills (including SQL) are critical.
  • Strong project management skills and can plan, coordinate, and track multiple experiments simultaneously.
  • A willingness to travel four weeks out of the year to meet with your team and the rest of the company (global pandemics permitting).

 

Bonus points if you have:
  • a creative approach to challenges.
  • the ability to pick up new concepts quickly.
  • flexibility and the ability to handle ambiguity gracefully.
Let's talk about the benefits. Here are a few perks you can look forward to:
  • Location: Our company is 100% remote. You can be based anywhere in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, France, Germany, Belgium, Poland, Kenya, Rwanda, Senegal, or South Africa. We will consider contractors in countries not listed on a case-by-case basis.
  • Competitive Compensation
  • Major benefits:
    • Subsidized health insurance and retirement contribution matching (both vary from country to country)
    • 26 weeks of fully paid parental leave and subsidized fertility assistance
    • Unlimited vacation with a 20-day minimum requirement
    • $10,000 annual charitable donation matching
And best of all:
  • Our team of over 400 employees is fully distributed across the world. We are working from coffee shops, homes, and co-working spaces — making us one of the larger fully distributed growth-stage startups in the world.
  • We are proud parents, community organizers, farmers, band members, yoga teachers, YouTube influencers, former Olympians, and serial entrepreneurs.
  • We collectively speak over twenty languages, including Akuapem, Amharic, Bengali, Ewe, Fante, Ga, Igbo, Kalenjin, Luganda, Oromo, Somali, Swahili, Wolof, Bulgarian, Croatian, Czech, Danish, Dutch, English, Estonian, Finnish, French, German, Greek, Hungarian, Irish, Italian, Latvian, Lithuanian, Maltese, Polish, Portuguese, Romanian, Slovak, Slovenian, Spanish and Swedish.
  • We recently joined forces with WorldRemit, another remittance company. We’re excited about the ways we can collaborate and continue to provide the best service to our users.
Ready to apply?

Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. If interested, please submit your resume along with a cover letter highlighting why your experience demonstrates you meet the requirements of the role. Please also indicate the countries in which you have work authorization.

Confidence can sometimes hold us back from applying for a job. But we'll let you in on a secret: there's no such thing as a 'perfect' candidate. Sendwave is a place where everyone can thrive. So however you identify and whatever background you bring with you, please apply if this is a role that would make you excited to wake up every day.

results.title: Product Manager
results.description:
Who we are:
Bixal is a mission-driven, woman-owned small business determined to improve people's lives through human-centered strategies and transformative technologies, with a firm belief that everyone has the right to an effective government.  
 
We deliver on this belief by partnering with leading Federal agencies to design, develop, and deliver powerful customer experiences through holistic digital product solutions and strategic communications initiatives––bringing a high standard and unique creative energy to our clients––and our wonderfully diverse culture is what makes it all possible.  
 
Bixal unites different people with different perspectives from all over the world! We provide our team with an open and empowered environment where collaboration thrives and solutions flourish. 
 
Location:
This role can work remotely from anywhere in the USA. You must be legally authorized to work in the US.  Bixal does not provide visa sponsorship.  
 
What will you do?
Bixal is looking for mission-driven, forward-thinking technologists and communicators interested in helping improve the customer experience around government services. As the Product Manager, you will lead a cross-functional digital product team, establishing and aligning work streams around a product vision based on research and data. Further, you will act as an advocate for the client/Product Owner, ensuring that the product solves for user needs and achieves business objectives.
 
The ideal candidate is a curious and independent problem solver who can design and deliver products with a positive attitude, and who has experience in a client-facing role.
 



Responsibilities:
  • Act as the product champion.  
  • Evangelize customer needs and product concepts internally and externally to obtain buy-in and drive adoption.  
  • Develop a deep understanding of target customer needs and apply it to defining, designing, building and launching products.  
  • Evaluate complex product ideas or requests and effectively elicit product requirements, articulating a rationale for those that are worth pursuing.  
  • Translate goals and objectives into outputs or user stories for the Bixal product team to implement.  
  • Lead collaboration with the team and stakeholders using “design thinking” to identify corrective and beneficial product direction and take the initiative to see these through.  
  • Prioritize functionality on a product roadmap.  
  • Lead product-related communications with client stakeholders and the Bixal internal team.  
  • Prioritize the product backlog to ensure goals and objectives of the client/Product Owner(s) are achieved.    
  • Orchestrate the activities of a cross-functional team to ensure that workstream outputs complement each other and remain oriented toward solving identified user needs.  
  • Confidently curate and present information in front of Product Owners, client stakeholders, or Bixal leadership as requested.   
  • Establish, measure, and report on product success metrics.
  • Create, review and approve written, graphic and summary documents and presentations for internal and external use in communicating product goals and objectives.    
  • Participate in meetings and/or demonstrations with client POCs as needed.  
  • Perform other duties or special projects as assigned.   



Qualifications:
  • Bachelor's degree required.  
  • Ability to undergo and obtain a Public Trust security clearance.   
  • 5+ years of total professional experience. 
  • 3+ years of experience managing cross-functional product teams in positions of increasing complexity and responsibility.    
  • Demonstrated ability to navigate uncertainty and define product expectations in an environment where product concepts are not well understood.  
  • Ability to understand technical challenges and make educated trade-offs with the team and stakeholders.   
  • Ability to communicate the functional capabilities of websites and applications in layman's terms with business and technical stakeholders.   
  • Ability to advocate for prioritized product outcomes against clearly defined goals.  
  • Exceptional management and leadership skills.  
  • Excellent soft skills: good communicator, emotionally intelligent, empathetic, good follow-up, polite, positive attitude.  
  • Proven track record of managing issues and risk through mitigation strategies.  
  • Demonstrated history of interfacing with internal project teams and senior management, as well as external clients and other stakeholders.   
  • Experience in human-centered design principles and adoption of Agile mindset.  
  • Strong written and oral communications skills.  
  • Sharp attention to detail and excellent organization skills.   
  • Strong experience and comfortability with Microsoft Office suite, Keynote, and virtual collaboration tools such as Miro.   



Nice to Haves:
  • Certified Product Manager (CPM) or equivalent product management certification.    
  • Background in or experience with design thinking processes and tools.  
  • Experience with the USDS Playbook and U.S. Web Design System.  
  • Experience with Drupal and JIRA.   
  • Familiarity with Customer Relationship Management platforms.
  • People management/supervisory experience preferred.  
Perks & Benefits:
Competitive base salary
Flex hours
Work from home flexibility
401K with matching incentive
Parental Leave
Medical/dental/vision benefits
Flex Spending Account
Company provided short-term disability
Company provided life insurance
Commuter benefits
Generous PTO
11 Paid holidays
Professional development opportunities
New business referral bonus
 
Bixal is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. It ensures equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment based on race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, national origin, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, genetic information, citizenship status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

results.title: Product Manager M/F/X
results.description:
DESCRIPTION OF THE COMPANY 

Reveal believes in the power of B2B collaboration so much so that we named our SaaS category after it — Collaborative Growth.

Launched in 2019, Reveal’s mission is to empower B2B Partnerships to drive tangible ROI.

Thanks to Reveal's technology, B2B partners can securely connect their CRM with their ecosystem, instantly identify all common accounts, and easily collaborate to source and influence more deals together.

Since 2019 we’ve created a community of +6,000 companies, +9,000 partnerships, and +10,000 community members across the world.

We’re backed by top-tier VCs (Insights Partners, 8Roads, Kima...) and have already raised $50m in a Series A to convert all revenue builders into believers of Collaborative Growth, and revolutionize the future of B2B partnerships.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES

The network product team is responsible for growing a key part of Reveal’s value: the network of companies and partnership connections between those companies. The Product Manager for the network squad will work closely with the Head of Product, Product Designer, Dev team, Product Marketing and Go-to-market.  You will be in charge of : 

  • Defining the roadmap for the network team based on a deep understanding of the user and business needs
  • Collaborating with the product designer to scope prioritized solutions to their smallest coherent and functional state in order to deliver quickly, validate your hypothesis and plan the next iterations
  • Collaborating with the lead developers to coordinate and inspire a small and passionate team through ambiguity, challenges, and pivots, fostering positive outcomes by working across the organization
  • Ensuring the Product Marketing team understands what we are building and why, align on the release strategy and "get the product out of the shelves

 

REPORTING LINE

 This job will report to the Head of Product.

 

YOU WILL LOVE THIS JOB IF 

  • You are a leader: you understand your success will require coordination across multiple teams and disciplines, so you play a critical role in creating alignment and ensuring we all succeed together as a team
  • You are very structured when it comes to elaborating on a topic: You look for hypotheses that need validating, which metrics bring actionable insight, and know-how to measure success
  • You are self-driven, will work on top of the business goals, and own your projects and initiatives
  • You are deeply empathetic, take customers' pain points as your own and represent them on a daily basis

 

YOUR BACKGROUND 

  • Minimum 2-5 years experience
  • Experienced with data-driven and agile product development
  • If you have work experience in a sector that is close to ours, for example having worked with B2B SaaS products or close to CRMs, it's definitely a plus!

 

WHY JOIN US 

  • A rare (once-in-a-lifetime?) opportunity to join an ambitious start-up at an early stage.
  • A deep dive in a project with experienced entrepreneurs, who are looking for excellence.
  • Very competitive compensation and permanent position opportunity because we are looking for excellence. 
  • A stimulating work environment, in a nice co-working space located in the 9th district, where you can both enjoy outdoor spaces and meet inspiring people from other start-ups!
  • A remote-ish friendly team with team buildings.
  • A company MacBook.

 

 HIRING PROCESS 

  • The journey starts with a phone interview with Talent Acquisition Manager (20 min)
  • Then a face-to-face (virtual) meeting with the Head of product (45 minutes)
  • This will then be followed by a live case study with pre-read materials  with the Head of Product and a Sr. Product Manager (1 hour)
  • Interview with Lead developer and Head of go-to-market (45 min)
  • You will be asked to provide us with professional references including contact details. 

 

Intrigued? We’d love to hear from you! Apply today — we’re standing by for your resume!

👉 We are an international  **SaaS B2B start-up** founded in 2018 and we’re searching for new talents across the globe to continue growing. Join us! 

👉 We believe that, in order to create a product for everyone, we must also guarantee that it is built by a diverse team. We embrace diversity and invite applications from people of all walks of life. We don't discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences. We are very process-light, putting human interactions above and making sure that everybody is heard.
